comments:
build I20040225

- was stepping through some tests
- they succeeded, so I resumed and the workbench under test exited
- got the following while it was shutting down

org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: 
The application has not been initialized.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.assertInitialized
(InternalPlatform.java:242)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.log
(InternalPlatform.java:620)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.handleException
(InternalPlatform.java:375)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run
(InternalPlatform.java:790)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners.doNotify
(JobListeners.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners.done
(JobListeners.java:136)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.endJob(JobManager.java:372)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.WorkerPool.endJob(WorkerPool.java:119)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:72)

This appeared in the debug console.
Nothing of interest was in either my host's log or the runtime test workspace's.

It is failing to write to the log since the platform is no longer running. The
safe runnable mechanism should not throw exceptions, so I will change it to only
write to the log if the platform is running. If the platform is not running, it
will write the exception on stderr.  In this situation, the exception that was
being logged got lost due to the exception attempting to write to the log file.

traces.message: assertion failed:  The application has not been initialized.
